questions.question: At the beginning of Act I, Scene 1 how do we know that Caesar is a powerful man?

choices.answer: He defeated Brutus in a fight
He beat Mark Antony in a wrestling match
He defeated Pompey in a civil war
He beat Cassius across a river in a swimming contest

questions.question: What is the plebians' loyalty like?

choices.answer: They are steadfast
They are fickle
They are unwavering
They are constant

questions.question: How does Caesar demonstrate his overconfidence in Act 1?

choices.answer: He dismisses the soothsayer's warning
He says he is stronger than Death
He threatens a lion
He ignores warnings about Brutus

questions.question: What is ethos?

choices.answer: A rhetorical appeal to an audience's emotions
A rhetorical appeal that uses logic and reason
A rhetorical appeal related to the speaker's trustworthiness
An appeal related to the speaker's personal opinions

questions.question: What is logos?

choices.answer: A rhetorical appeal to an audience's emotions
An rhetorical appeal that uses logic and reason
A rhetorical appeal related to the speaker's trustworthiness
An appeal related to the speaker's personal opinions

questions.question: What is pathos?

choices.answer: A rhetorical appeal to an audience's emotions
A rhetorical appeal that uses logic and reason
A rhetorical appeal related to the speaker's trustworthiness
An appeal related to the speaker's personal opinions

questions.question: Which of the following items is portentous?

choices.answer: The soothsayer's warning
Portia stabbing herself in the leg
The mention of a clock in Act II
Mark Antony running in a race

questions.question: Which of the following items is an example of an anachronism?

choices.answer: The soothsayer's warning
Portia stabbing herself in the leg
The mention of a clock in Act II
Mark Antony running in a race

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a soliloquy?

choices.answer: When Portia is begging Brutus to tell her his secrets.
Mark Antony standing over Caesar's body talking of revenge.
When Decius convinces Caesar to go to the capital.
When the soothsayer says, "Beware the Ides of March."

questions.question: What is an aside?

choices.answer: Words spoken so everyone can hear them
A long speech to share a character's thoughts
Private words for just the audience or a specific character
A short and amusing story

questions.question: Who are the plebians?

choices.answer: Roman senators
The actors in a play
A group of women
Commoners

questions.question: Which of the following is not a theme from the play?

choices.answer: Growing up is difficult
Women have no power in Roman society
Overconfidence can lead to disaster
Misinterpreting signs can lead to trouble

questions.question: Which of the following supports the theme of inflexibility?

choices.answer: Caesar compares himself to the North Star
Cassius defeats Caesar in a swimming match
Portia stabs herself in the leg
Calphurnia has a nightmare about Caesar

questions.question: Which of the following characters is left alive at the end of the play?

choices.answer: Brutus
Mark Antony
Cassius
Julius Caesar

questions.question: In Caesar’s last few speeches, when he refuses to pardon Publius Cimber, his tone is:

choices.answer: proud and arrogant
excited and irrational
reasonable and accommodating
kind and sympathetic

questions.question: What figure of speech is used in the following: “But I am constant as the Northern Star...”?

choices.answer: alliteration
simile
personification
an anachronism

questions.question: Which of the following does Antony use to his advantage during his funeral speech for Caesar?

choices.answer: Caesar's will
Caesar's cloak
Caesar's body
All of the options

questions.question: According to Antony why is Brutus the most noble of the Romans?

choices.answer: He killed Caesar to gain power
He killed Caesar to protect Rome
He killed Caesar due to his jealousy
He killed Caesar because he was greedy

questions.question: Which of the following is not an example of irony?

choices.answer: Mark Antony saying he is not as good of an orator as Brutus
Mark Antony read the will of Caesar
Brutus wanted peace, but instead got civil war
Antony repeatedly says Brutus is an honorable man

questions.question: What component of the plot structure occurs in Act III when the conspirators kill Caesar?

choices.answer: rising action
falling action
climax
resolution
